title: Colorado vs. Oregon State preview
text:
Colorado vs. Oregon State preview Gary Horowitz , Statesman Journal 7:52 p.m. PDT October 23, 2015 Oregon State band performs an NCAA college football game in Corvallis, Ore., Saturday, Sept. 19, 2015 (Photo: Timothy J. Gonzalez, AP) 3 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
When : 7:30 p.m. today 
Line : OSU by 2 1/2 
TV : PAC-12 Networks 
Four-Down Territory 
FAST START 
In the Beavers' last two games - losses at Arizona and Washington State - they were out of the game at halftime. A better start is essential for OSU's chances. 
PAC-12 FUTILITY 
Colorado is 4-35 in conference games since joining the Pac-12 in 2011 with 14 consecutive losses in conference play. The Buffaloes blew a fourth-quarter lead last week against Arizona, but the time could be right for a breakthrough. Nick Mitchell moves into backup QB role 
WHERE'S VILLAMIN? 
Wide receiver Jordan Villamin is the Beavers' best deep threat, but he has been a non-factor the past two games with five catches for just 36 yards and one TD. OSU needs to incorporate him more in the offense. 
BRING THE HEAT 
The Beavers have struggled to find a consistent pass rush this season and their eight sacks ranks last in the Pac-12. OSU needs to make quarterback SefoLiufau uncomfortable in the pocket. 
Key Matchup 
OSU CB DWAYNE WILLIAMS VS. COLORADO WR NELSON SPRUCE 
Williams will be making his second career start and he has a difficult assignment against Nelson Spruce, the Buffaloes' leading receiver. 
Who has the edge? 
Rushing offense 
Seth Collins is fourth nationally in rushing among QBs, but the Buffaloes have more balance in their running game. Edge : Colorado 
Passing offense 
SefoLiufau has thrown for 1,730 yards and eight TDs. OSU is last in the Pac-12 in passing. Edge : Colorado 
Rushing defense 
Neither team excels in this area. By comparison, OSU gave up 368 yards rushing to Arizona and Colorado allowed 291. Edge : Even 
Passing defense 
The Beavers are giving up 216.2 ypg through the air, and the Buffs are close behind at 219.3. Edge : Even 
Special teams 
Victor Bolden had a 100-yard kickoff return for a TD against WSU. Edge : OSU 
Injuries 
Both teams will be missing key players. CB Larry Scott (ankle) is out for the Beavers, and WR Shay Fields is not expected to play for Colorado. Edge : Even 
Coaching 
Colorado is 1-20 in Pac-12 games under Mike MacIntyre. OSU coach Gary Andersen had success at Utah State and Wisconsin. Edge : OSU 
Intangibles 
It's homecoming at Reser Stadium. Bummer that it's another night game for the Beavers. Edge : OSU 
The bottom line 
In an evenly matched game between Pac-12 bottom feeders, give OSU a slight edge playing at home. Edge : OSU
